entry.title: Self-Taught Developer's Fastest Path to a Developer Job
entry.summary: This morning while I was eating breakfast, I opened YouTube and saw a video by self-taught developer Brian Cache: "The FASTEST Way to Learn to Code and ACTUALLY Get a Developer Job" (Capital letter emphasis is his own. The video is an 11 minute watch): I love watching these types

entry.title: Learn the Basics of Java Programming
entry.summary: Java has been a popular programming language for over two decades. Learning Java is a good way to mastering the fundamentals of modern coding practices. We just posted a full course on the freeCodeCamp.org YouTube channel that will teach you the basics of Java programming. Alex Dobinca Cristian developed

entry.title: An Overview of Prismane – An Open-Source React UI Library
entry.summary: Prismane is a free, comprehensive, have-it-all React UI library that provides a broad array of hooks, components, and form validators to help you build beautiful and functional user interfaces. Prismane was designed with performance in mind, ensuring lightning-fast loading times for a better user experience. In this article, you will

entry.title: How to use HTML Elements – Headings, Paragraphs, and Text Formatting Elements Example
entry.summary: HTML, which stands for HyperText Markup Language, is the standard markup language used to create webpages. HTML provides a structured way to organize content on a webpage, allowing web developers to present text and media in a clear and meaningful way. In this article, we'll explore three fundamental HTML

entry.title: Nuxt 3 Course for Beginners
entry.summary: Nuxt.js has been making waves in the web development world, especially among Vue.js enthusiasts. With its unique capabilities for server-side rendering, static site generation, and single-page applications, Nuxt offers a robust set of features for developers looking to build modern web apps. We just posted a full course on Nuxt

entry.title: Getting Started With Neon Branching
entry.summary: Branches are a really nice (and safe) way to configure or reconfigure your database without fear of screwing up the production database. Let’s take a closer look at how branching works with [Neon](https://neon.tech/), and the good news is, you probably already know how it works!

entry.title: Smashing Podcast Episode 65 With Alex Older: How Do You Run A Grassroots Conference?
entry.summary: We’re talking about running grassroots conferences and meet-ups. What does it take to organize a small industry event for your community? Drew McLellan talks to WDC’s Alex Older to find out.

entry.title: How to Use Dynamic Programming to Solve the 0/1 Knapsack Problem
entry.summary: The art of computer science often revolves around solving problems that are seemingly simple at first glance, but dig a little deeper and you'll find intricate challenges that demand creativity, logic, and precision. One such iconic problem is the 0/1 Knapsack Problem. We just published a new course on the

entry.title: WaterBear: Building A Free Platform For Impactful Documentaries (Part 1)
entry.summary: Adrian’s kicking off a two-part series, sharing his journey as a lead developer. In the process, you will learn about the lessons and insights Adrian gained at work, including the strategies that went into the technical stack of the project and what it looks like to collaborate with a team he is leading for the first time.

entry.title: Python List Methods Explained in Plain English
entry.summary: We often make plans about the things we want, what we need to do, and places we want to visit. These lists could go on forever! However, there are times when we need to build a program that requires us to organize and manipulate information using lists. In this

entry.title: Understanding Java Internals: Speed and Performance
entry.summary: In most conversations about programming, speed, and efficiency in Java are reoccurring terms as it's a language native to these features. You might ask, what is Java? You may also wonder what it means for a programming language to be interpreted or compiled. Let's explore these concepts in the following

entry.title: Understanding Word Embeddings: The Building Blocks of NLP and GPTs
entry.summary: Word embeddings serve as the foundation for many applications, from simple text classification to complex machine translation systems. But what exactly are word embeddings, and how do they work? Let's find out. What Are Word Embeddings? Word embeddings serve as the digital DNA for words in the world of natural

entry.title: An Introduction to HTML for Beginners
entry.summary: HTML, which stands for HyperText Markup Language, serves as the foundation of web development. It enables you to create interactive web pages, structure content, and effectively communicate your message. In this guide, we'll explore HTML comprehensively, addressing essential questions to provide a strong foundation for budding web developers. The

entry.title: The Path To Awesome CSS Easing With The linear() Function
entry.summary: With the new CSS `linear()` easing function on the horizon, the possibilities of what we can do to create natural-feeling animations and transitions in the future are greatly expanded. Jhey Tompkins looks at the current state of CSS easing in this article and demonstrates what we can expect from `linear()`, including handy tools to get your hands on it today.

entry.title: Facilitating Inclusive Online Workshops (Part 2)
entry.summary: To help ensure the success of a workshop, Ben Shih introduces the concept of an inclusive workshop. In Part 2 of the series, you will continue to delve deeper into several key principles and guidelines that you can follow during and after the workshop to encourage an inclusive atmosphere.

entry.title: How Smashing Magazine Uses TinaCMS To Manage An Editorial Workflow
entry.summary: This article is a peek behind the curtain of how content is managed here at Smashing Magazine. In it, you’ll get a tour of an article’s full lifecycle, from a basic outline to the sort of thing you’re reading right this second.

entry.title: Revealing Images With CSS Mask Animations
entry.summary: Let’s play with images and experiment with CSS masks. The idea is fairly simple: take a single `` tag and harness the power of CSS to accomplish complex hover transitions. Through different demos, you will see how CSS masks combined with gradients allow us to create fancy effects — with efficient, reusable code.

entry.title: Facilitating Inclusive Online Workshops (Part 1)
entry.summary: Running a workshop can be an effective alternative to traditional, long-standing meetings. To help ensure its success, Ben Shih introduces the concept of an inclusive workshop. In Part 1 of the series, you discover the fundamentals of inclusivity and get some solid guidance on how to plan an inclusive remote workshop.

entry.title: Gradients, Blend Modes, And A Really Cool Hover Effect
entry.summary: Gradients are a powerful CSS feature. We use them for texture, depth, and even to hide parts of elements with CSS masking. This article covers another interesting way to use gradients — as a hover effect that affects the appearance of other elements around the hovered element.

entry.title: Rediscovering The Joy Of Design
entry.summary: Pratik Joglekar takes a philosophical approach to remind designers about the lost joy within themselves by effectively placing massive importance on mindfulness, introspection, and forward-looking. Without joy, the work we do would feel meaningless. To prevent it from happening, check out a few ideas that would help rediscover that spark of joy.

entry.title: Long Live The Test Pyramid
entry.summary: Is the Test Pyramid really dead? Discover the more contemporary testing strategies and evaluate the Test Pyramid’s relevance in today’s software development practices.

entry.title: Generating Real-Time Audio Sentiment Analysis With AI
entry.summary: In this article, Joas Pambou builds the tool to provide a sentiment score in **real-time** with enhanced user experience by providing multilingual support. You will use an OpenAI library called Whisper that transcribes audio files into text and detects the language, and Gradio, a UI framework, to establish the interface.

entry.title: A September Of Never Ending Adventures (2023 Wallpapers Edition)
entry.summary: Let’s get ready for September with some fresh wallpaper designs! Created with love by artists and designers from across the globe, the wallpapers in this collection come in versions with and without a calendar. Enjoy!
